revised_title: The Role of the Medulla Oblongata in Diabetes: A Study on Nervous System Lesions
tldr: This study investigates the effects of nervous system lesions, particularly those involving the medulla oblongata, on diabetes. The author conducts a series of experiments on animals and concludes that the medulla oblongata plays a crucial role in regulating blood sugar levels. The experiments also suggest that the sympathetic nervous system may be involved in this process.
